SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AcceptedLoginController
This class governs the GUI of the transition phase between a login request and its acceptance by the controller.
AcceptedLoginMessage
This class is ised as an accepted login message sent from server to a client
AlmostOverMessage
This message is used from the server to report all players in a game when the first library in the game is fully filled with objectCards
BadMoveMessage
This message is used when a player sends a not valid move
Board_C
This class governs the GUI of the game board where libraries, object cards grid and different types of goal cards are present.
Card
This class is the abstract "Card" class that all other types of card extend.
CardGenerator
The class CardGenerator is a complete manager for all game card in a single Game.
CentralServer
This class serves as a central server for the subsequent creation of two dedicated servers, one for the management of network communication via RMI technology and the other for the management of network communication via Socket technology.
ChatController
The class is dedicated to managing the chat and the messages that players write and send within it.
ChatMessage
This message contains a chat text that represents a chat message sent from a player to another
Cli
This class handles input and output in cli version
Client
This class is a generic Client.
ClientApp
This class starts the client application.
ClientController
The logical controller of a client
ClientLoginController
This class governs the GUI of the phase in which the user enters the login information that will then be used to connect the player to the game or the pre-game lobby.
ClientModel
This class is a not complete copy of a model maintained by server.
Color
Enum representation of the color of an object card
ColumnInsertionQuestionController
This class governs the GUI of the insertion phase of the library column chosen by the player to insert the cards just chosen from the grid.
Common_C
This class governs the GUI of common goal cards so that it maintain its initial proportion in the case the main board stage is resized.
CommonCardManager
This class is a CommonCard deck manager.
CommonGoalCard
This class is the abstract "Common goal card" class that all other common goal cards extend.
CommonGoalCard0
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard1
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard10
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard11
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard2
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard3
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard4
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard5
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard6
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard7
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard8
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCard9
This class contains the algorithm to verify if the following common goal is satisfied.
CommonGoalCardDescriptionController
This class is the controller associated to the "CommonGoalCardDescription.fxml" file.
CommonGoalMessage
This message is used to inform all players in the game that a common goal was reached by a player
CommunicationQueueHandler
This class manages queue containing messages.
Connection
This class is used to send or receive message from client.
Controller
Controller responsible for login and game creations
Couple<E1,E2>
A generic class that includes two generic objects
CustomizedFunction<R>
This interface is used to create an object that represents a method.
Direction
Enum representation of the possible direction that a depth search algorithm can use
ErrorClientCreationController
This class governs the GUI dedicated to the error phase of creating a player within the game, after the user has entered and submitted the initial data required to be able to participate in the game.
ErrorGameController
This class governs the GUI used to show the players an error occurring during the game which will cause the closure of the game.
ErrorMessage
This message is an error message sent by a server to a client
Game
This class is used as a model representation of the game.
GameController
the controller of a specific game
GameController.StatusGame
 
GameHasBegun
This class governs the GUI used to signal players the start of the game.
GameMessage
This is a generic game message, used to inform clients for game start or game over
GoodMoveMessage
This message is used to inform a client whose move was performed successfully and gained points
Grid
This class represents the grid of the living room.
Grid_C
This class governs the GUI of obect cards grid so that it maintain its initial proportion in the case the main board stage is resized.
GridMessage
This message is used by server to update players on a central grid update.
GridMessage.TypeOfGridMessage
Subclass used to recognize when a grid update is related to a player move or its an initial update (used for GUI refill)
GuiApplication
This class starts the GUI application.
InputStateCLI
This class is used by the CLI to set the destination of the user input in the CLI.
InvalidLoginInput
This class governs the GUI dedicated to managing the unavailable or incorrect choice of connection port between client and server.
InvalidMoveController
This class governs the GUI used to signal players the choice of an invalid move.
InvalidMoveException
Thrown when a move is estimated as not valid in the model, reasons can be many
InvalidNumObjCardsController
This class governs the GUI used to signal players the choice of an invalid number of object cards currently in the grid.
InvalidNumPlayersController
This class governs the GUI dedicated to handling the phase of incorrect entry of the total number of players participating in the game.
InvalidUsernameController
This class governs the GUI dedicated to managing the unavailable choice of a player name by a client, it allows to choose another player name.
InvalidUsernameMessage
This message is used to send an inavild username answer to the client
Library
Library class contains methods related to all actions which are controlled by the library of each player.
Library_C
This class governs the GUI of each player library so that it maintain its initial proportion in the case the main board stage is resized.
LibraryMessage
This message is used by server to update players on a library update.
LibraryPopUpController
This class is the controller associated to the "libraryPopUp.fxml" file.
LivingRoom
This class represents the living room of the game, a class that contains the central grid, the card generator and the extracted commonGoalCard.
LobbyUpdateMessage
This message returns an update reporting a lobby description and the size of the lobby
LoginMessage
This message is build after a server network interface receives an RMILoginMessage or SocketLoginMessage.
Message
The abstract representation of a generic network message.
MessageType
 
MoveMessage
This message is used from client and servers to aks or send game moves
NewGameServerMessage
This message is used for the process of server changing when a Game is created.
NumberRequestTask
This task it activated when the first user in a lobby takes too long to choose a number of players.
ObjectCard
This class is the concrete "Object card" class that represent cards which are placed in the board grid or in player libraries.
ObjectCardManager
This class is an ObjectCard deck manager.
OBS_ChangedUsernameMessage
Message used by a View to notify client controller the new username to use
OBS_ChatMessage
This message represents a chat message sent from view to client controller
OBS_InitialInfoMessage
This message contains initial user information to send to client controller
OBS_Message
This abstract representation for OBS_Message
OBS_MessageType
Type of message sends by client's input stream (or scanner)
OBS_MoveMessage
This message contains the move that the user wants to perform
OBS_NumberOfPlayerMessage
This message contains the number of players that user wants to play with
OBS_OnlyTypeMessage
This message is used only to comunicate a message type to client controller
Observable<Event>
Class used to handle observation of event
Observer<SubjectType extends Observable<Event>,Event>
Interface used to implements Observer class objects
Personal_C
This class governs the GUI of personal goal cards so that it maintain its initial proportion in the case the main board stage is resized.
PersonalCardManager
This class is a PersonalCard deck manager.
PersonalGoalCard
This class is the concrete "Personal goal card" class that represent cards which are separately given to each specific player.
PersonalGoalCardPopUpController
This class is the controller associated to the "PersonalGoalCardPopUp.fxml" file.
PingerTask
It sends a ping to a client.
PingHandler
This class manages queue containing messages.
PingTaskClient
This method activates client controller in case of an error message from the server.
Player
This class represent the model of a player.
PlayerNumberAnswer
This message is used from clients to tell the server the max number of players that will join the lobby
PlayerNumberRequest
This message is used by the server to send a client a request for the max number of players to include in the lobby
PlayerNumberRequestController
This class governs the GUI dedicated to managing the choice of the number of players who will participate in the game, the choice is made by the first player to connect to the server.
Point_C
This class governs the GUI of the points displayer so that it maintain its initial proportion in the case the main board stage is resized.
Position
Class used to get a representation of a matrix position, with row and column
PrinterUtils
utility class useful to print proportioned grids in CLI
ResetMoveException
Thrown when the user wants to reset his move in the CLI
ReturnToGameMessage
This message notifies clients that they will be return to an old interrupted game
RMI_Client
This class is the RMI extension of the abstract Client class.
RMI_Server
This class serves as server for the management of network communication via RMI technology.
RMIClientConnection
 
RMIConnection
This class represents RMI connection with client
RMILoginMessage
This message is a login message used by RMI clients
RMIShared
This class serves as RMIShared object for the management of network communication via RMI technology server-side.
RMISharedInterface
This interface serves as an abstraction for RMIShared objects enforcing class that implements it to implement onMessage method.
ScoreMessage
This is a message containing an update on the points of all players in the game
ScorePointCard
This class is the concrete "Score point card" class that represent cards which display points that are awarded by achieving common goal card objectives.
ServerPingMessage
This message is used as a ping message between network interfaces
ServerReceiver
Interface that identifies an object able to receive message and act as a controller
SetupMessage
This is a message that contains all the elements needed by clients to begin a game.
Socket_Client
This class is the Socket extension of the abstract Client class.
Socket_Server
This class serves as server for the management of network communication via Socket technology.
SocketConnection
This class serves as connection for the management of network communication via Socket technology.
SocketLoginMessage
This message is a login message used by socket clients
StartController
This class governs the GUI dedicated to the initial start scene: it manages the interaction between the user and the graphic components of the scene.
StatusNetwork
This enum-class is used to handle error-connection.
TerminatorTask
This task is called to disconnect a client when he takes too long to answer with the ping message
TurnController
A controller created each time a turn needs to be handled
Type
Enum representation of the color of an object card, each card can have 3 different skin called types
View
This class is the abstract class for managing the creation of stages, the succession of scenes and their changes during the game.
ViewFactory
This class manages the creation of stages, the succession of scenes and their changes that characterise the game.
WinnerMessage
This is a message used by server to all players about the winner of the game, providing also a sorted ranking in decreasing order
WinnerSceneController
This class is the controller associated to the "WinnerScene.fxml" file.
